Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior glazed black; part of possible rosette in added white outline with added red centres above lozenge pattern band between white lines; below, part of double outlined rosette with petals alternating in red and black; exterior reserved with three brown lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941. For parallels regarding the exterior decoration, see British Museum 1924,1201.606.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2005) (phase 2)
